page.title: 13WYBERTON
page.content: WYBERTON The original village of Wyberton is grouped around St Leodegar's church and Wyberton park ,which is now a large country house but was once the home of the Rector of Wyberton.It is a residential village,having no amenities except a telephone kiosk and a pillar box .Until thirty years ago the school was in the village.In 1955 a new school was opened in the parish close to a large new residental area near the A16 which runs from Boston to Spalding.This new school is outside the section covered by this survey.The village has developed rapidly along the A16 and the old part has been left as a dormitary village .Most of the people who live there work in nearby Boston.There has been private non-estate building in the past 15 yrs but the village is compact
